com.spotify.sdk.android.playback

Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.spotify.sdk.android.playback.Player
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ConnectionStateCallback, NativePlayer.AudioDeliveredCallback, NativePlayer.AudioFlushCallback, Executor, ExecutorService

    public class Player
extends Object
implements ExecutorService, ConnectionStateCallback, NativePlayer.AudioDeliveredCallback, NativePlayer.AudioFlushCallback
    This class is responsible for playback of Spotify content. Only one instance of this class may be instantiated at any given time; having multiple instances will cause problems. This class relies on native components for doing the actual streaming and communication with Spotify's backend services. This native code is distributed in a separate shared library. Normally you should not need to directly instantiate this class, instead you should use Spotify.getPlayer(Config, Object, com.spotify.sdk.android.playback.Player.InitializationObserver) to obtain a refcounted instance for you.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  Player.InitializationObserver
      Observer interface used to know when the player is fully initialized.

      • Player

        protected Player(Player.InitializationObserver observer,
                 NativePlayer nativePlayer)
        Direct instantiation not allowed, instead use create(Config, com.spotify.sdk.android.playback.Player.InitializationObserver).
        Parameters:
        observer - Observer to be notified when initialization is complete (or fails)
        nativePlayer - Instance of the native player. Can be null, in which case the default NativeSdkPlayer will be used.

    • Method Detail

      • create

        public static Player create(Config config,
                            Player.InitializationObserver observer)
        Create a new player instance. Normally you shouldn't call this method directly, instead use Spotify.getPlayer(Config, Object, com.spotify.sdk.android.playback.Player.InitializationObserver) Creating multiple instances of the Player class is asking for trouble!
        Parameters:
        config - Configuration variables used during native initialization
        observer - Observer to be notified when initialization is complete (or fails)
        Returns:
        Initialized player instance
        See Also:
        Spotify.getPlayer(Config, Object, com.spotify.sdk.android.playback.Player.InitializationObserver)

      • create

        public static Player create(NativePlayer nativePlayer,
                            Config config,
                            Player.InitializationObserver observer)
        Create new player instance and inject NativePlayerInstance. This method should be used only in testing.
        Parameters:
        nativePlayer - Instance of the native player.
        config - Configuration variables used during native initialization
        observer - Observer to be notified when initialization is complete (or fails)
        Returns:
        Initialized player instance

      • onTemporaryError

        public void onTemporaryError()
        Description copied from interface: ConnectionStateCallback
        Sent when service has been interrupted, usually by lack of network access. However, it can also occur if there is a problem with Spotify's backend services, or also when the user switches from WiFi to 3G. These errors can occur in many non-critical situations, and thus it is not necessary to show toasts or alert dialogs when receiving this event, or else you will unnecessarily annoy or panic the user. However, it can be useful to know about these events if operations are consistently failing, in which case showing a toast or alert may be justified.
        Specified by:
        onTemporaryError in interface ConnectionStateCallback

      • onNewCredentials

        public void onNewCredentials(String credentialsBlob)
        Description copied from interface: ConnectionStateCallback
        May also be sent when the user finishes logging in. The credentials blob may be stored in your app's local preferences to automatically log the user in when the app starts.
        Specified by:
        onNewCredentials in interface ConnectionStateCallback
        Parameters:
        credentialsBlob - Credentials blob for the user

        Connection message sent from the server to the user.

        Parameters:

      • play

        public void play(String uri)
        Play a URI with the player. If the player is not yet fully initialized, this call will be queued and executed when the player's runloop is ready. Note that not all types of Spotify URIs are supported here, the list of supported URIs includes:
        • Single tracks
        • Playlists
        Please note that the Album URIs are not yet supported
        Parameters:
        uri - URI to play

      • play

        public void play(List<String> trackUris)
        Play track list with the player. If the player is not yet fully initialized, this call will be queued and executed when the player's runloop is ready.
        Parameters:
        trackUris - A list of tracks to play. Each element of the list needs to be a valid Spotify track URI e.g. "spotify:track:6ui6l3ZNvlrGQZArwo8195"

      • play

        public void play(PlayConfig playConfig)
        Play context defined by the PlayConfig object. If the player is not yet fully initialized, this call will be queued and executed when the player's runloop is ready.
        Parameters:
        playConfig - An object that desribes the context to play (see PlayConfig for details). The object contains information about uri/uris to play as well as about optional track index to start playback from and optional initial position of the first track played in the context.

      • queue

        public void queue(String uri)
        Add a URI to be played next in the queue. Note that not all types of Spotify URIs are supported, see the documentation for play(String) for a list of supported URIs.
        Parameters:
        uri - URI to play

      • clearQueue

        public void clearQueue()
        Clears the queued tracks

      • pause

        public void pause()
        Pause playback. Safe to call even if not playing or already paused.

      • resume

        public void resume()
        Resume playback if paused.

      • skipToNext

        public void skipToNext()
        Skip to the next track in the play queue.

      • skipToPrevious

        public void skipToPrevious()
        Skip to the previous track in the play queue. To start playing the current track from the beginning, use seekToPosition(int) with 0.

      • seekToPosition

        public void seekToPosition(int positionInMs)
        Jump to a given position in the current track.
        Parameters:
        positionInMs - Position in milliseconds

      • setShuffle

        public void setShuffle(boolean enabled)
        Enable or disable shuffling.
        Parameters:
        enabled - True to enable shuffling, false to disable it.

      • setRepeat

        public void setRepeat(boolean enabled)
        Enable or disable repeat.
        Parameters:
        enabled - True to enable repeat, false to disable it.

      • getPlayerState

        public void getPlayerState(PlayerStateCallback callback)
        Fetch current player state from native SDK. This method will be executed on the player thread and its result posted back to the caller thread.
        Parameters:
        callback - Triggered when player state is returned.

      • setConnectivityStatus

        public void setConnectivityStatus(Connectivity status)
        The native SDK needs to be told what the current connection state is in order to determine ideal connection settings to Spotify's servers. For more information on the usage of this method, see the Connectivity class and the demo app source code which is shipped with the Spotify SDK for Android.
        Parameters:
        status - Connectivity status
        See Also:
        Connectivity.fromNetworkType(int)

        Parameters:

      • onAudioDelivered

        public int onAudioDelivered(short[] frames,
                            int numFrames,
                            int sampleRate,
                            int channels)
        Description copied from interface: NativePlayer.AudioDeliveredCallback
        Called every time raw audio data is received.
        Specified by:
        onAudioDelivered in interface NativePlayer.AudioDeliveredCallback
        Parameters:
        frames - Audio data delivered to by the native SDK
        numFrames - Number of frames in the frame buffer.
        sampleRate - Sample rate of delivered buffer.
        channels - Number of channels for delivered buffer.
        Returns:
        The number of frames written to the output.
